intro: Lucuma montana, commonly known as the mountain lucuma, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces large, yellow-orange fruits that are encased in a thick, fibrous husk. The fruit is rich in nutrients, including vitamin C, fiber, and various minerals, making it a valuable food source. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils.
